<<<<<<< HEAD
The rivall friends A comœdie, as it was acted before the King and Queens Maiesties, when out of their princely favour they were pleased to visite their Vniversitie of Cambridge, upon the 19. day of March. 1631. Cryed downe by boyes, faction, envie, and confident ignorance, approv'd by the judicious, and now exposed to the publique censure, by the author, Pet. Hausted Mr. in Artes of Queenes Colledge. Hausted, Peter, d. 1645.
[112] p.
printed by Aug. Matthewes for Humphrey Robinson, at the signe of the three Pidgeons in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1632.
Partly in verse. Signatures: A-O⁴. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery, San Marino, California.
=======

printed by Aug. Matthewes for Humphrey Robinson, at the signe of the three Pidgeons in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1632.
